meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the relationship between texts.
meanings.sent1: The intertextual analysis compared different stories to find similarities.
meanings.sent2: The professor discussed the intertextual connections between the novels.
meanings.sent3: The intertextual references in the movie made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was intertextual, weaving together various literary influences.
meanings.sent5: The intertextual nature of the poem made it a joy to decipher.

meanings.definition: Referring to the use of one text in another text.
meanings.sent1: The intertextual reference to Shakespeare added depth to the play.
meanings.sent2: The author's intertextual approach enriched the novel's themes.
meanings.sent3: The intertextual twist in the story caught the readers off guard.
meanings.sent4: His intertextual writing style was like a tapestry of borrowed words.
meanings.sent5: The intertextual elements in the script created a captivating narrative.

meanings.definition: Characterized by references or connections to other texts.
meanings.sent1: The intertextual nature of the article made it informative and engaging.
meanings.sent2: The intertextual links between the poems revealed hidden meanings.
meanings.sent3: The intertextual nods to classic literature added a playful touch.
meanings.sent4: Her intertextual storytelling was a mosaic of literary allusions.
meanings.sent5: The intertextual web of references in the book was intricate and fascinating.
